newsitem.title: EGYPT: Milling firms boost trading on Cairo bourse.
newsitem.headline: Milling firms boost trading on Cairo bourse.

text.p: Popular milling shares led Egyptian share upwards on Thursday while a handful of deals in the financial sector helped boost volume.
Blue-chip North Cairo Flour Mills, the day's most active stock, rose another 2.50 pounds to 94.50, capping its gains throughout the week.
Central Egypt Flour Mills was a close second, but only gained 0.30 pounds to 24.55.
"We're very bullish about the mills, there's plenty of room for expansion and they will go far," said Ramzi Zaki of Financial Brokerage Group.

Brokers said the market had closed higher after a bullish day but the Capital Market Authority's overall index fell 0.30 points to 233.48. The independant Prime IPO Index rose 0.77 percent to 2311.6 points.
The CMA did not give a figure for total turnover but brokers said both Misr Exterior Bank and blue chip Commerical International Bank (CIB) were among the day's most heavily traded shares.
Misr Exterior leaped 80.00 pounds to 600.00 in two high-volume closed deals while CIB gained 3.00 to 450.00 in a few deals.

Newly privatised Kafr el-Zayat Pesticides and Chemicals continued to rally amid rumours of a takeover bid which brokers said may have been launched by a rival firm. Shares rose 8.00 pounds to 55.00 pounds in heavy trade.
The CMA index for openly traded firms rose to 335.17 points from 334.98 points on Wednesday. The index for the rarely traded "closed" firms fell to 160.49 points from 160.97.
